In 1998, Telephone lines per 100 population was 6.1, and went up to 9.7 in 2008.
In 2000, Cellular subscribers per 100 population was 2.6, and went up to 33.9 in 2008.
In 2000, Internet users per 100 population was 5.4, and went up to 22.9 in 2009.
In 2000, Net enrolment ratio in basic education was 92.2%, and declined to 83.9% in 2007.

Construction of Sewage Treatment Plant in Khan Younis
Construction of Sewage Treatment Plant in Khan Younis

description.narrative: Khan Younis Waste Water Treatment Plant (KY WWTP) is a strategic environmental project aims at protecting public health, water resources and environment of more than 320,000 residents of Khan Younis Governorate in the Gaza Strip.
populated place
Accountability - local government finance

1. Availability of additional fund required to implement and construct KY WWTP, Phase I. 2. The constructability review (design review), pre-contract and construction supervision services for KY WWTP being professionally provided by experienced international consultant to deliver the required outputs on time and to the appropriate quality. 3. Availability of functional waste water treatment plant of a capacity of 26,600 cubic meters per day to access 217,000 residents of Khan Younis to safe municipal waste water treatment services; 4. Availability of effluent and emergency pressure pipeline with a total length of 18.6 kilometers to discharge the treated waste water to the infiltration basins and to the sea outfall in emergency cases. 5. Availability of infiltration basin on 97 dunums area to annually recharge more than 9 million cubic meters of treated waste water into the aquifer to ultimately be used for agricultural purposes. 6. Availability of electrical power supply line required to operate the plant. 7. Level of engagement of local operators in implementing and operating waste water treatment plants.

comment.narrative: 1. The available fund from the Government of Japan is not sufficient to implement the comprehensive project of KY WWTP, Phase I 2. Limited local experience to provide constructability review (design review), pre-contract and construction supervision services for large scale treatment plants with complexity and sophisticated technology 3. Khan Younis has an absolute absence of functional waste water treatment plant. 4. Khan Younis waste water treatment plant will not be functional without effluent and emergency pressure pipeline 5. Around 5.2 million cubic meters of untreated waste water filtrated annually to aquifer via cesspits and around 4.3 million cubic meters discharged to the Mediterranean Sea in Khan Younis. 6. Khan Younis waste water treatment plant site has no power supply connection. 7. Not adequate experience of local operators to effectively implement and operate waste water treatment plants.

2. The contract of the provision of the design review, pre-contract and construction supervision services for the construction of Khan Younis waste water treatment plant signed with the most responsive proposer and the work activities commenced.

2. The contract RFP 2014-287 of the provision of the design review, pre-contract and construction supervision services signed between UNDP/PAPP and Artelia Ville &Transport and Universal Group consultant in the total amount of USD 2,944,594 on 30 July 2015 and the work activities commenced on 10 August 2015.

Social Protection, Land Housing and Community Amenities - disaster prevention and preparedness
No. of Early Recovery Cluster meetings Information management system for early recovery in place No. Detailed sex and age disaggregated needs of livelihoods sectors assessed Advocacy and Awareness

comment.narrative: large areas of the Gaza strip, in particular industrial areas, were reduced to rubble and more than 15,000 houses were reportedly damaged or destroyed. Damages to the water and sanitation systems and networks have left hundreds of thousands people without access to potable water and released considerable flows of untreated sewage in open areas. In the agricultural sector, widespread destruction of cultivated land, greenhouses, livestock and poultry farms are not only depriving thousands of Gazans from livelihood and employment opportunities, but are also impacting negatively on the food security situation of the strip. Loss of livelihood opportunities has resulted in unemployment rates reaching 70 to 80% in some areas. Environmental destruction, sewage contamination and seepage will require a large-scale programme for the safe removal of rubble and unexploded ordnance as well as special attention on longer term implications for the environment and on environmental health.

description.narrative: Rubble removal from affected sites in Gaza city and crushing for reuse activities

description.narrative: Contribute to national economic growth through developing the Palestinian tourism sector by revitalized cultural infrastructure and increased engagement of Public-Private Partnerships (PPPs)

description.narrative: A fully-operational Khan al Wakale (Nablus) complex; and a Guest House and Touristic Centre established in Maqam En-Nabi Musa (Jericho) on top of an institutionalised model for PPP in the management of cultural heritage
Health - policy, planning and administration
1. Number of Palestinians ( dis-aggregated by Gender) benefited from increased access to economic facilities

This project aims to promote knowledge and awareness in Human Development in oPt. It is part of a multi-phased programme designed for advocacy in oPt as per UNDP's contribution to setting the development agenda and supporting development debate.

The NHDR project will be implemented in three tracks. It involves the preparation of the NHDR itself, cover the carrying out of the quarterly surveys on perceptions and the production of Human Development materials and programme development support.

title.narrative: Palestinian National Unity and Social Cohesion Programme

description.narrative: The project aims to strengthen Palestinian National Unity by addressing issues pertaining to national reconciliation, civil service reintegration, improving local capacities and planning schemes, as well as the social cohesion of Palestinian society.

The project aims at anchoring national unity and social cohesion throughout the Palestinian society through support to consolidated governance mechanisms, social reconciliation, & enhanced civic engagement.

comment.narrative: 1. Some 4,600 civil servants in the health and education sector hired pre-June 2007 (app. 30%) receive a salary but have not been reintegrated, while some 8,900 civil health and education personnel hired after June 2007 by the then de facto authority are attending work, but are not receiving a regular salary. 2. Absence of a coordination mechanism federating reconciliation initiatives. 3. Absence of a monitoring mechanism for implementation of reconciliation agreements; 4. Absence of a recovery strategy for the Gaza Strip.

description.narrative: This project, through the construction of Industrial hangars in the Jericho Agro Industrial Park, is a second phase of ongoing support under the Supplementary Budget support from Japan for the Fiscal Year 2013.
